page.title: 03INDUSTRY,SAUNDERSFOOT
page.content: In 1829 the first breakwater was built followed quite quickly by the north walls.The north wall had to be extended for often,boats were blown out off the harbour.The first trade concerning Saundersfoot was called the Bristol run.There was no railway this far west, it was expensive to bring goods by road.Sailing boats brought goods such as beer,flour,salt, sugar tea and candles from Bristol.These were then taken by horse and cart to the surrounding villages.With the growth of the coal trade at Bonvilles Court,Reynalton and Loveston, Saundersfoot harbour developed rapidly as a coal outlet.Coal was sent all over the world from Saundersfoot.The harbour was owned by the Saundersfoot Railway and Harbour Company.However the trade in coal declined during the middle 1930's.There were one or two
